title: Alex Health rebrand + marketing landing page + polished authenticated UI

requirements.summary: Rebrand all visible product naming to “Alex Health” across landing, authenticated shell, and HTML metadata.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page header shows "Alex Health" instead of any previous name.
Authenticated header/app shell shows "Alex Health" instead of any previous name.
frontend/index.html <title> is updated to include "Alex Health" and reflects a professional marketing title.
No user-facing text shows the old product name.

file_operations.description: Update the document title and any brand-related metadata to consistently use “Alex Health” with a professional marketing-style title.
Replace all visible brand references (header text, hero copy, image alt text) with “Alex Health”, ensuring no remaining “VitalFlow” user-facing strings.
Update authenticated app shell branding (header logo alt text and product name) to “Alex Health”, ensuring no remaining “VitalFlow” user-facing strings.

requirements.summary: Strengthen the unauthenticated landing page with professional dieting + exercise marketing, including concrete example plan formats and the plans+documentation workflow, while keeping a single primary login CTA.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page includes at least 2 distinct sections that explicitly cover dieting and exercising with example plan formats (not just generic statements).
Landing page includes at least one section describing the "plans + documentation" workflow in clear, user-facing English (what gets planned, what gets logged, and what users get back from it).
Landing page keeps a single primary CTA to log in and remains visually consistent with the rest of the site.

file_operations.description: Add professional marketing sections for (1) dieting with a concrete sample meal-plan structure + what users log, and (2) exercising with a concrete workout-plan structure + what users log; add a dedicated section explaining the “plans + documentation” loop and outcomes; keep a single primary CTA button that triggers Internet Identity login. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive, professional visual theme (typography/spacing/accent direction) across landing and authenticated UI, supporting light and dark modes without editing immutable shadcn/ui sources.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page and authenticated views share consistent styling for headings, cards, buttons, and section spacing.
UI remains readable and polished in both light and dark modes.
No changes are made to read-only component sources under frontend/src/components/ui; styling is achieved via composition and app-level styles.

file_operations.description: Refine global theme tokens and base typography/spacing defaults (light + dark) to establish a consistent, professional accent color direction and heading scale across the app.

Align landing sections (hero, marketing blocks, examples) to the updated global theme using consistent spacing, card treatments, and button hierarchy via composition (no edits to frontend/src/components/ui). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adjust app shell spacing/typography and header/nav visual hierarchy to match the global theme (consistent container rhythm, button styles, and section spacing) via composition (no edits to frontend/src/components/ui). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Polish post-login usability: clearer navigation state, improved layout hierarchy, and professional empty/loading states across key authenticated views (desktop + mobile) without adding new backend features.
acceptanceCriteria: Authenticated header/nav is visually polished and clearly indicates the current section on both desktop and mobile.
Primary actions in core areas (e.g., logging/reminders) are easy to discover without adding new backend features.
Views present professional empty states (when there is no data yet) and non-jarring loading states.

file_operations.description: Improve navigation clarity by adding a stronger active-state treatment for the current view (desktop + mobile), ensure touch-friendly spacing on mobile, and preserve clear logout behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable authenticated empty-state component (icon/title/description/optional primary action) to standardize professional empty states across views. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a lightweight, non-jarring loading-state component for view-level loading placeholders that matches the global theme and works in light/dark mode. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adopt the shared EmptyState/LoadingState patterns: show a polished loading placeholder while exercise data is loading and upgrade empty states to include a clearer next-step action (e.g., guidance to Daily Logs) without introducing new features. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Improve layout hierarchy and first-use clarity: ensure primary logging actions remain easy to discover on mobile, and apply shared LoadingState/EmptyState patterns for the day’s exercise/wellness data. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Apply shared EmptyState/LoadingState patterns and refine the header/action layout so the primary action (Add Reminder) remains prominent and the empty state looks polished. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Refine visual hierarchy and loading behavior for progress charts: present a consistent loading placeholder and a professional no-data state when the selected range has no exercise logs, keeping UI consistent across light/dark. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
